docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Alarmed by an evident increase in violent and disruptive behavior, universities are reviewing codes of student conduct and tightening their disciplinary procedures. In the process, they are running into legal quandaries over how to treat students who have psychological disabilities but whose antisocial acts threaten campus life.

headline.main: Colleges Tightening Discipline As Disruptive Behavior Grows

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In a reversal of policy, the White House has approved broad and strict regulations intended to halt the proliferation of disease-prevention claims on food packages, Federal officials said today.

headline.main: In Reversal, White House Backs Curbs on Health Claims for Food

docs.snippet: LEAD: In a reversal of policy, the White House has approved broad and strict regulations intended to halt the proliferation of disease-prevention claims on food packages, Federal officials said today.

byline.original: By PHILIP J. HILTS, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A drug that is being taken for long periods by tens of thousands of infants and young children to prevent convulsions is ineffective and inhibits intellectual performance, at least temporarily, researchers have found.

headline.main: Drug for Babies' Seizures Is Found Ineffective and Perhaps Harmful

docs.snippet: LEAD: A drug that is being taken for long periods by tens of thousands of infants and young children to prevent convulsions is ineffective and inhibits intellectual performance, at least temporarily, researchers have found.
